Mac and Cheese with Broccoli

Jump to Recipe

Mac and Cheese with Broccoli is a comforting and delicious dish that combines the classic flavors of creamy cheese and tender macaroni with the nutritional boost of fresh broccoli. This recipe is perfect for busy weeknights or as a delightful side dish for family gatherings. With just a handful of simple ingredients, including elbow macaroni, sharp cheddar cheese, and vibrant broccoli florets, you can create a satisfying meal that everyone will love. Not only does the addition of broccoli enhance the dish's flavor and texture, but it also adds a dose of vitamins and minerals, making this mac and cheese a wholesome choice. In this article, we will guide you through each step of the recipe, ensuring that your mac and cheese turns out perfectly creamy and cheesy every time. Whether you're making it for kids or adults, this Mac and Cheese with Broccoli will surely become a new favorite!

Ingredients

elbow macaroni

If you don't have elbow macaroni, you can substitute it with any small pasta shape like shells, penne, or fusilli. For a healthier option, consider whole wheat or gluten-free pasta. Make sure to cook it al dente, as it will continue to cook when mixed with the cheese sauce.

broccoli florets

Fresh broccoli is preferred for its crisp texture, but you can also use frozen broccoli florets. If using frozen, just microwave them for a minute or two before adding to the dish. To enhance flavor, consider sautéing the broccoli briefly in olive oil and garlic before mixing it with the mac and cheese.

cheddar cheese (shredded)

For the best melting properties, use a good quality sharp cheddar. You can mix in other cheeses like Gruyère, Monterey Jack, or even a bit of cream cheese for creaminess. If you're looking for a lower-fat option, reduced-fat cheddar can work, but it may not melt as smoothly.

milk

Whole milk provides the creamiest texture, but you can substitute it with 2% or skim milk if desired. For a richer flavor, consider using half-and-half or adding a splash of cream. For a dairy-free version, use almond milk, coconut milk, or soy milk.

butter

Unsalted butter is ideal for controlling the saltiness of the dish. You can substitute with margarine or a plant-based butter for a dairy-free option. If you're looking for a healthier fat, consider using olive oil or avocado oil.

flour

All-purpose flour works best for the roux, but you can substitute it with gluten-free flour or cornstarch (use half the amount) if needed. If you're aiming for a nutty flavor, try using whole wheat flour.

salt

Adjust the salt to your taste, particularly if using salty cheese or broth in the recipe. You can use sea salt, kosher salt, or even garlic salt for added flavor.

pepper

Black pepper is traditional, but feel free to use white pepper for a milder taste or add a pinch of cayenne pepper or smoked paprika for a kick. Freshly ground pepper will elevate the flavor more than pre-ground.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Elbow Macaroni

    In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add a pinch of salt. Once boiling, add 8 oz of elbow macaroni. Cook according to package instructions until al dente, usually about 8-10 minutes. Drain the pasta and set aside. Note: Adding salt to the water enhances the flavor of the pasta.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Broccoli

    While the macaroni is cooking, you can prepare the broccoli. Steam 2 cups of broccoli florets for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are bright green and tender but still crisp. This can be done in a steamer basket over boiling water or in the microwave with a splash of water. Tip: If you prefer, you can blanch the broccoli in boiling water with the macaroni for the last 2-3 minutes of cooking.

  • Step 3: Make the Roux

    In the same large pot (to minimize cleanup), melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Once melted, whisk in 2 tablespoons of flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook for about 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until it forms a paste (roux). This step is crucial for a smooth cheese sauce.

  • Step 4: Add Milk and Thicken

    Gradually whisk in 2 cups of milk, ensuring there are no lumps. Continue to cook over medium heat, whisking frequently, until the mixture thickens and starts to bubble, about 3-5 minutes. Expert Tip: Use whole milk for a creamier sauce.

  • Step 5: Incorporate the Cheese

    Once the mixture is thickened, reduce the heat to low and stir in 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese. Stir continuously until the cheese is completely melted and the sauce is smooth. If you desire a more intense flavor, consider mixing in a bit of grated Parmesan cheese.

  • Step 6: Combine Pasta, Broccoli, and Cheese Sauce

    Add the drained macaroni and steamed broccoli to the cheese sauce. Stir gently until everything is well combined and coated in the creamy cheese sauce. Make sure the broccoli is evenly distributed throughout the macaroni.

  • Step 7: Serve and Enjoy

    Spoon the creamy mac and cheese with broccoli into bowls and serve warm. You can garnish with additional cheese, breadcrumbs, or fresh herbs if desired. Enjoy your delicious homemade dish!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I cook elbow macaroni properly?

To cook elbow macaroni, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the macaroni and cook according to the package instructions, usually about 8-10 minutes, until al dente. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking, then drain and set aside.

How do I prepare broccoli florets?

Wash the broccoli thoroughly under running water. Cut off the stem and separate the florets into bite-sized pieces. You can steam or blanch the florets for about 3-4 minutes until bright green and tender, then drain.

What is a roux and how do I make it?

A roux is a mixture of flour and fat (like butter) used to thicken sauces. To make a roux, melt butter in a pot over medium heat, then whisk in an equal amount of flour. Stir continuously for about 1-2 minutes until it turns a light golden color.

How can I tell when the cheese sauce is thickened?

The cheese sauce is thickened when it coats the back of a spoon. You can test this by dipping a spoon into the sauce; if it leaves a clean line when you run your finger through it, it's ready!

What should I do if my cheese sauce is too thick?

If your cheese sauce becomes too thick, simply whisk in a little more milk, a tablespoon at a time, until you reach your desired consistency.

Can I use different types of cheese?

Absolutely! Feel free to mix different cheeses such as mozzarella, gouda, or even pepper jack for a kick. Just make sure to maintain the total amount of cheese to about 2 cups.

How do I safely handle hot pots and pans?

Always use oven mitts or pot holders to handle hot pots and pans to prevent burns. Make sure to set hot items on heat-resistant surfaces and keep a clear workspace to avoid accidents.

What’s the best way to store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-5 days. Reheat in the microwave or on the stovetop, adding a splash of milk to keep it creamy.

How can I make my mac and cheese extra creamy?

To make your mac and cheese extra creamy, you can add a little cream cheese or sour cream to the cheese sauce. You can also use a combination of cheeses for more depth of flavor.

What can I serve with mac and cheese?

Mac and cheese pairs well with a simple green salad, roasted vegetables, or even grilled chicken for a complete meal. Enjoy!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To make this dish vegetarian-friendly, it is already suitable as it contains no meat. For a gluten-free option, substitute elbow macaroni with gluten-free pasta, and use a gluten-free flour for the roux. If you're looking to reduce dairy, try using plant-based milk and cheese alternatives, such as cashew cheese or almond milk.

Pairings

For a delicious pairing, serve the Mac and Cheese with Broccoli alongside grilled chicken or baked salmon for a protein boost. A light, crisp salad with a citrus vinaigrette can also complement the richness of the cheese. Beverage-wise, pair it with a chilled glass of Chardonnay or a light lager to balance the creamy texture.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Mac and Cheese with Broccoli hot from the stove for the best experience. Consider garnishing with a sprinkle of extra shredded cheese or breadcrumbs for a crunchy texture. For a fun twist, serve it in individual ramekins or cups for a more casual presentation. A side of garlic bread or a simple green salad would elevate the meal.
